result.execSummary:
The defendant Teangelo D Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes:
PROBATION REVIEW HEARING SEPTEMBER 18, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR. 23.
*Probation review hearing October 30, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory corut costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges. To be paid during period of probation.  If revoked, to be paid from 25% of prison funds.  Balance paid during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order; and advised due to DV conviction under Federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.  Court advised defendant due to felony convicttion, defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with Larissa A. or her minor children, her residence, including 2555 N. 22 Street, Milwaukee, WI or any future residence unless approved by the  Court or agent, except for third party contact if applicable for time with the child as approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.
Court did not grant expungement in this case.

Batterers Intervention Program.
Parenting classes.
Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review hrg.
*8/7/2015  stay lifted as to 30 days.  Straight time.  Order for Commitment signed/filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teangelo D Carroll

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Teangelo D Carroll in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; straight time, the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 10/30/2015 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
At request of DOC agent Polasky, matter has been set for an early review on 8/7/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 36. Court VACATED 9/18/2015 review date.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Court reviewed and returned CD of photographs to the state.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 YEARS,  credit for 9 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 6 MONTHS Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Larissa A. or her minor children, her residence, including 2555 N. 22nd Street Milwaukee, WI, or any future residence unless approved by the court or agent, except for third party contact if applicable for time with the child as approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court did NOT grant expungement in this case.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned  per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.

Defendant Teangelo D Carroll in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored, an must provide a DNA sample.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 03/19/2015 received and filed. (14 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Kevin Gaertner, 230 W. Wells St., Milwaukee, WI 53202

Defendant Teangelo D Carroll in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Teangelo D Carroll in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Nancy Nelson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23. State placed Defense on notice that conditions of bail may be addressed at the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case spun to Preliminary Hearing Court.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM010737  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/02/15

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Larissa A or her children;  No contact with either the upper or lower unit of residence
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Teangelo D Carroll in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  
Defendant Teangelo D Carroll in custody.  
Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
